intro: Knautia kochii, commonly known as the alpine knautia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its clusters of pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Knautia kochii is valued in gardens for its ornamental flowers and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
